channel.title: Pohutukawa
channel.description: a mobile-first WordPress blog theme by Elmastudio

item.title: back to the city
item.dc:creator: feinifuh
item.excerpt:encoded: You can apply a border to your images adding the CSS class "img-border" to the image.

item.title: Contact
item.dc:creator: ellen
item.content:encoded: To use forms you can install the Contact Form 7 WordPress plugin. After installation of the plugin just create a new form via the Contact Form 7 settings page and copy/paste the shortcode into a page or post. [contact-form-7 id="941" title="contactform1"]

item.title: About
item.dc:creator: ellen
item.content:encoded:
Adding an About page... cheesecake wypas macaroon halvah. Muffin bear claw cookie carrot cake. Dragée tart fruitcake macaroon soufflé I love I love. Applicake marshmallow brownie cotton candy liquorice lemon drops jujubes bear claw. I love muffin cotton candy macaroon carrot cake sesame snaps apple pie. item.title: Blog Archives
item.dc:creator: ellen
item.content:encoded:
[smart_archives] [divider]

How to create the Archive page

To include a archive of of all your blog posts you can use the "Smart Archives Reloaded" WordPress plugin. After the theme installation just include the shortcode [smart_archives] into a new page. In the plugin settings (see Settings/Smart Archives in the Admin panel) you can choose "both" as the Format, so the block and list archive elements both will be displayed.

wp:comment.wp:comment_content: Anonymous person pretending to be Matt.

Author comment. Header one Header two Header three Header four Header five Header six Blockquote Tests Blockquote:
Here's a one line quote.
This part isn't quoted. Here's a longer quote:
It’s like a language. You learn the alphabet, which are the scales. You learn sentences, which are the chords. And then you talk extemporaneously with the horn. It’s a wonderful thing to speak extemporaneously, which is something I’ve never gotten the hang of. But musically I love to talk just off the top of my head. And that’s what jazz music is all about. Stan Getz
And some trailing text. Table Layout Test Title Views About Test User 1 More 260 1 More Archives 1 More 235 1 More List Type Tests Definition List Definition List Title This is a definition list division. Definition An exact statement or description of the nature, scope, or meaning of something: our definition of what constitutes poetry. Gallery A feature introduced with WordPress 2.5, that is specifically an exposition of images attached to a post. In that same vein, an upload is "attached to a post" when you upload it while editing a post. Gravatar A globally recognized avatar (a graphic image or picture that represents a user). A gravatar is associated with an email address, and is maintained by the Gravatar.com service. Using this service, a blog owner can configure their blog so that a user's gravatar is displayed along with their comments. Unordered List (Nested) List item one List item one List item one List item two List item three List item four List item two List item three List item four List item two List item three List item four Ordered List List item one List item one List item one List item two List item three List item four List item two List item three List item four List item two List item three List item four HTML Element Tag Tests All other HTML tags listed in the FAQ: Here is the address for Automattic, using the <address> tag: 355 1st Street Suite 202 San Francisco, CA 94105 United StatesThis is an example of an <anchor> (otherwise known as a link). This abbr. is an example of an <abbr> tag in the middle of a sentence. Here is a TLA showing off the <acronym> tag. What, you want to see some over-sized text using the <big> tag? Can you cite a reference for that, using the <cite> tag? Have you noticed that all of the tag names are displayed in code-form, using the <code> tag? Similarly, I could emulate keyboard text, using the <kbd> text tag, or emulate teletype text using the <tt> tag. Oh no! I wrote something incorrectly. I'd better delete it, using the <del> tag. I could alternately strike something out using the <strike> tag, or strike something out using the <s> tag. So many choices, which I emphasize using the <em> tag. Just to clarify, this is some inserted text, that I'll highlight using the <ins> tag. Need to display completely unformatted text, such as a large block of code? Use the <pre> tag, which lets you display: #container { float: left; margin: 0 -240px 0 0; width: 100%; } Want to quote the WordPress tagline Code is Poetry? Use the <q> tag to add quotes around it. This is strong text (otherwise known as bold), using the <strong> tag. Need to write H2O or E = MC2? You may find great use for subscripting text using the <sub> tag, or for superscripting text using the <sup> tag. Need to call out a variable? Use the <var> tag. item.title: Text Elements
item.dc:creator: ellen
item.content:encoded:
Have a look at all the font styles like headlines, blockquotes, list elements or tables. You can also use the extra CSS class "intro" to include an intro text in a bigger font size to your posts.

item.title: Enjoying the View
item.dc:creator: feinifuh

item.title: Quote by Mark Twain
item.dc:creator: feinifuh
item.content:encoded: Twenty years from now you will be more disappointed by the things you didn’t do than by the ones you did do. So throw off the bowlines, sail away from the safe harbor. Catch the trade winds in your sails. Explore. Dream. Discover. Mark Twain

item.title: Roadtrip
item.dc:creator: ellen
item.content:encoded: [gallery] This is the gallery post format. Just upload some images into a post using the Upload Media button and create an image gallery with the [gallery] shortcode. Now you can choose the »gallery« post format in the Format field. In your admin panel Settings/Media you should choose a thumbnail size of around 250px x 250px and and enable the cropping option.

item.title: Testing the link post format
item.dc:creator: ellen
item.content:encoded: Detailed Pohutukawa theme documentation → To use the Link post format just add the class="link" to the first link of the post.

item.title: Audio Post Format
item.dc:creator: ellen
item.content:encoded: [soundcloud url="http://api.soundcloud.com/tracks/37664567" params="auto_play=false&show_artwork=true&color=ff7700" width="100%" height="166" iframe="true" /] [divider] You can use the Soundcloud widget with iframe embed code to include audio tracks into your posts. To embed the code it's best best to use the Soundcloud Shortcode WordPress plugin.

item.title: Pohutukawa WordPress Theme
item.dc:creator: ellen
item.content:encoded:
Pohutukawa is a fun, modern WordPress blog theme best suited for personal blogs. The theme options like the big header image feature or the layout options make it easy to customize the theme and give it an individual style. Pohutukawa is responsive and mobile-first, so your website is optimized to be viewed on all kinds of devices like smartphones, tablets and desktop computers. The responsive theme layout will adapt to different screen sizes automatically. The mobile-first design approach also garanties that all buttons and menu navigations are suited for small screens and your content can be easily explored by your readers.

Theme Options

Pohutukawa is best suited for personal blogs. The theme options are easy to use and you can personalize your theme design with simple steps in just a few minutes. You can customize link and font colors, the footer widget color, upload your own logo image or include share buttons for Facebook, Twitter and Google+.

Big Header Image Feature

With the big header image feature you can customize your theme even further and give it an individual style.

One-Column or Sidebar layout option

On the theme option page in the admin panel you can also choose to use Pohutukawa with a right sidebar or in the one-colimn layout. The one-column layout features your post content beautifully and gives your blog an modern, minimalistic style.

Mobile-first Menu

To support a mobile optimized site navigation on small screens the Pohutukawa theme includes a mobile menu button. With this feature the screen will not be totally covered by a big navigation menu that hides all your newest blog posts on smartphones. Instead the navigation menu is included below your newest content and the reader can reach the navigation via the menu button. To make it even easier for your readers to explore your content there is also a search form right at the top of your site on mobile devices.

Custom Widgets

Next to the standard WordPress widgets you can use a custom Pohutukawa Social Links widget to link to your Social profiles on Twitter, Facebook, Google+, Flickr, Vimeo, YouTube, Foursquare, Last.fm, Dribbble and many more. You can also use a custom Flickr widget to show some preview Flickr pictures and include your latest video with the Featured Video widget. Pohutukawa also supports a number of external plugin widgets like the Twitter and Image widget from Jetpack for WordPess. All widgets can be included in either the sidebar or the footer widget area.

Post Formats

To create more interesting and fun blog posts you can use the WordPress post formats Image, Gallery, Quote, Link, Aside, Status, Audio and Video next to standard posts.
Find out more
If you want to learn more about using the Pohutukawa theme have a look at the video tutorials and the detailed PDF documentations (both in English and German language) or ask us a question on the Pohutukawa theme page.

item.title: Header Images
item.dc:creator: ellen
item.content:encoded: Pohutukawa has a beautiful big header image feature. The theme comes with 4 header images to choose from (see Appearance / Header). Of course you can also upload your own header images in the size of 1400x440 pixels (jpg, try to keep the file size small). You can choose to rotate different images on page loads or include one image as a single header image. If your image has a dark color you can choose the white header font color on the theme options page.
